snippet: When the jobs market weakened in March and April, economists could tell a sensible story about why the weakening wasn't as severe as it looked. But you can't tell that story anymore. For the third straight year, the economy has fallen into a spring...
abstract: When the jobs market weakened in March and April, economists could tell a sensible story about why the weakening wasn't as severe as it looked. But you can't tell that story anymore. For the third straight year, the economy has fallen into a spring slump.
